repnme.cdata!:
Haiti - Economic Governance Reform
            Operation Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The development objective of the
            Economic Governance Reform Operation Project (EGRO) was
            support the Government's efforts to adopt measures that
            will increase the transparency of, and efficiency in the use
            of public resources, and external assistance with the
            increasing participation of the private sector, and civil
            society in decision-making, and the provision of services.
            Project ratings are as follows: Project outcome is
            satisfactory; risk to development outcome is satisfactory;
            Bank performance is satisfactory; and overall Borrower
            performance is satisfactory. The report cites the following
            as lessons learned: 1) Choice of lending instrument, the
            decision to do a two-tranche structural adjustment operation
            was adequate in view of the possible risks affecting the
            operation, 2) Client commitment, the successful
            implementation of the Government's program followed
            from its ownership and degree of commitment. 3)
            Institutional capacity, experience with the implementation
            of the EGRO has shown that the choice of its tranche
            conditionality was judiciously selective, focusing on those
            measures that were likely to make the greatest impact, were
            critical to the successful achievement of the program
            objectives and enjoyed broad Government support; donor
            coordination. As mentioned earlier, close coordination among
            donors in the provision of financial and technical
            assistance greatly contributed to the outcome of the reform
            program. The lessons detailed above are being taken into
            account for the preparation of EGRO II.

docna.cdata!: Haiti - Economic Governance Reform Operation Project

repnme.cdata!:
Haiti - Economic Governance Reform
            Operation - release of the floating tranche full compliance

abstracts.cdata!:
The Economic Governance Reform Operation
            for Haiti has provided financial support to the
            Government's stabilization program and helped implement
            critical economic governance reforms to increase
            transparency and efficiency in the use of public resources
            and external assistance. Critical objectives included: (a)
            improvement of budgetary processes; (b) strengthening of
            public procurement processes; (c) stepping up of
            anticorruption efforts; (d) improving efficiency and
            transparency in the management of public enterprises and the
            Road Maintenance Fund; and (e) creating a mechanism for
            civil society to monitor economic governance reforms and
            supporting Government communications efforts to increase
            public understanding and raise awareness of governance
            reforms. The conditions of release of the Development Credit
            Agreement and Development Grant Agreement between the
            Borrower and IDA dated January 06, 2005 (DCA and DGA) state
            that for the release of the second (floating) tranche the
            following conditions must be fulfilled: The macroeconomic
            policy framework of the Recipient is satisfactory.

5544737.trustfund:
TF055414-JSDF-HAITI: UPSTREAM
            ACCOUNTABILITY FOR ECONOMIC GOVERNANCE AND SERVICE

repnme.cdata!:
Haiti - Economic Governance Reform
            Operation Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Economic Governance Reform Operation
            Project (EGRO) will support the Government's efforts to
            adopt measures that will increase the transparency of, and
            efficiency in the use of public resources, and external
            assistance with the increasing participation of the private
            sector, and civil society in decision-making, and the
            provision of services. It is thus a key component of the
            Bank's program of re-engagement in Haiti, as described
            in the Transitional Support Strategy (TSS). Technical
            assistance (TA) for the implementation of the economic
            governance reform supported by the EGRO will be provided by
            the Bank through a recently approved Low Income Countries
            under Stress (LICUS) grant, and a technical assistance IDA
            project. The EGRO supports reform measures in the following
            main areas: fiscal management, budget processes and
            financial control; public sector procurement;
            anti-corruption strategy; human resource management;
            efficiency and transparency in the management of public
            enterprises, and road maintenance; public-private
            partnerships, and governance in the education and health
            sectors; civil society monitoring of economic governance
            reforms; and, enhanced public information system.
            Nevertheless, in addition to the political, and security
            risks faced by the country, two critical risks are: 1) weak
            institutional capacity; and, 2) the short time framework for
            implementation of the reforms supported by the EGRO. Since
            the transition period may prove too short to allow for
            lasting reforms in the civil service, the donor community
            has responded with proposed significant technical
            assistance, and efforts to coordinate it effectively. And,
            by supporting capacity building efforts, the proposed
            operation would also contribute to increasing the national
            absorptive capacity and therefore a faster disbursement of
            badly needed external assistance.
